name: skyscraper windows hat
notes:
i’ve been having so much fun with this stitch pattern that i couldn’t resist making a hat to match my cowls. for the sample hat i paired a strongly variegated contrast color with a nicely contrasting solid, and i love how each window turned out different–just like the inside of every window in a high rise would give you a view into a different room.
pick two strongly contrasting colors and settle in to knit your own skyscraper windows hat!

**yarn**
miss babs killington
85% polwarth wool, 15% tussah silk; 350 yd/4.2 oz (320 m/120 g) skeins
1 skein in main color, shown in mchale’s, 1 skein contrast color, shown in ziggy stardust

or 120 (140, 160) yards/110 (128, 146) meters of dk weight yarn in main color and 35 (40, 45) yards/32 (37, 41) meters of dk weight yarn in contrast color.

**sizes**
small, medium, large

**finished measurements**
circumference: 15 (18 ¼, 20)”/37.5 (45.5, 50) cm
height: 9 (9 ¼, 9 ½)”/22.5 (23, 24) cm
shown in size small

**needles**
• us 5 [3.75 mm] circular needle, 16”/40 cm long, and double pointed needles, or size to obtain gauge
• us 4 [3.5 mm] circular needle, 16”/40 cm long, or one size smaller than gauge needle

**gauge**
blocked: 24 stitches and 30 rounds = 4”/10 cm square in stranded stockinette stitch.

**notions**
• stitch marker
• tapestry needle
